1.brief: elevation, i.e. the act (literally, a journey to a higher place, figuratively, a thought arising), or (concretely) the condition (literally, a step or grademark, figuratively, a superiority of station); specifically a climactic progression (in certain Psalms)
David, the youngest son of Jesse
probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)

2.brief: to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive)
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda
an opening, i.e. door or gate
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine

3.brief: Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
to join (literally or figuratively); specifically (by means of spells) to fascinate

4.brief: there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence
to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative
a scion, i.e. (literally) a stick (for punishing, writing, fighting, ruling, walking, etc.) or (figuratively) a clan
a scion, i.e. (literally) a stick (for punishing, writing, fighting, ruling, walking, etc.) or (figuratively) a clan
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

5.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
properly, covered, i.e. a throne (as canopied)

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
properly, covered, i.e. a throne (as canopied)
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
David, the youngest son of Jesse

6.brief: to inquire; by implication, to request; by extension, to demand
safe, i.e. (figuratively) well, happy, friendly; also (abstractly) welfare, i.e. health, prosperity, peace
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine
to be tranquil, i.e. secure or successful
to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)

7.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
safe, i.e. (figuratively) well, happy, friendly; also (abstractly) welfare, i.e. health, prosperity, peace
an army; also (by analogy,) an intrenchment

8.brief: properly, heed, i.e. purpose; used only adverbially, on account of (as a motive or an aim), teleologically, in order that
a brother (used in the widest sense of literal relationship and metaphorical affinity or resemblance (like father))
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
'I pray', 'now', or 'then'; added mostly to verbs (in the Imperative or Future), or to interjections, occasionally to an adverb or conjunction
safe, i.e. (figuratively) well, happy, friendly; also (abstractly) welfare, i.e. health, prosperity, peace

9.brief: properly, heed, i.e. purpose; used only adverbially, on account of (as a motive or an aim), teleologically, in order that
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to search out (by any method, specifically in worship or prayer); by implication, to strive after

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
